english: you (someone of equal or lower status)
that gentleman/lady (polite form of あのひと)
Mr., Ms. (title of respect added to a name)
suffix added to a child's name instead of ~さん
suffix often added to a boy's name

furigana: どうぞよろしく　おねがいします
english: pleased to meet you (lit. please be nice to me)

furigana: ほんの　きもちです
english: it's nothing / it's a token of my gratitude
please / here you are (when offering someone something)

これから　おせわに　なります
english: I hope for your kind assistance hereafter

furigana: こちらこそ　よろしく
english: I am pleased to meet you (in response to どうぞよろしく)
here (place physically close to the speaker)
there (place physically distant from both speaker and listener)
that place over there (polite) / that way

もよおしものかいじょう

to write, to draw, to paint
just a minute, a little while, a little bit
rice covered with fried fish and vegetables
rice covered with chicken and egg
pancake grilled with meat, vegetables and egg

furigana: でんわを　かけます

english: May I come in? / excuse me / anybody home?
how nice of you to come (lit. welcome)

english: thank you / may I (lit. I'm afraid I'll be disturbing you)

furigana: ーは　いかがですか
english: would you like to have —? (offering something)

english: that's right / well, let me see

fixed place to catch taxis, trains, etc.

いって　いらっしゃい
